item.title: 华尔街创纪录后亚洲股市上涨；美元反弹
item.description: 在对美国利率前景至关重要的一周里，美元兑日元和英镑从多周低点反弹。【原文：Asian stocks climbed on Monday, buoyed by record high closes on Wall Street, while the dollar bounced back from multiweek lows against the yen and British pound in a crucial week for the U.S. interest rate outlook.】

item.title: 新加坡中央银行就关系经理不当行为对摩根大通罚款 180 万美元
item.description: 新加坡央行周一表示，对美国贷款机构摩根大通（JPMorgan Chase）处以 240 万新元（179 万美元）的民事罚款，原因是该公司未能预防和发现其客户关系经理的不当行为。【原文：Singapore's central bank on Monday said it fined U.S. lender JPMorgan Chase a civil penalty of S$2.4 million ($1.79 million) for failing to prevent and detect misconduct committed by its relationship managers.】

item.title: 澳大利亚拟议法律将就数字竞争问题对大科技公司处以罚款
item.description: 澳大利亚周一提议制定一项法律，如果全球科技公司压制竞争并阻止消费者在不同服务之间进行转换，则可对这些公司处以最高 5000 万澳元（3300 万美元）的罚款。【原文：Australia proposed a law on Monday that could impose fines of up to A$50 million ($33 million) on global technology companies if they suppress competition and prevent consumers from switching between services.】

item.title: 澳大利亚央行称非银行贷款机构风险有限
item.description: 澳大利亚央行周一表示，非银行贷款人参与证券化的风险有限，因为劳动力市场依然具有活力，为家庭和企业提供了支持，而且该行业的整体规模依然较小。【原文：Australia's central bank said on Monday that risks from non-bank lenders in securitisation are limited as the labour market remained resilient, supporting households and businesses, and the size of the sector remains small overall.】

item.title: 财新PMI显示，中国11月工厂活动增速创5个月新高
item.description: 周一的一项私营部门调查显示，由于新订单（包括来自国外的订单）带动生产稳健增长，11月份中国工厂活动以五个月来最快的速度扩张，推动制造商的乐观程度达到八个月来的最高点。【原文：China's factory activity expanded at the fastest pace in five months in November as new orders, including those from abroad, led to a solid rise in production, pushing manufacturers' optimism degree to an eight-month high, a private-sector survey showed on Monday.】

item.title: 分析师下调评级后，阿达尼的主要投资者 GQG 股价下跌 13
item.description: 在阿达尼集团（Adani Group）被起诉后，瑞银（UBS）分析师下调了该公司的股票评级，并估计该公司可能损失 6 亿澳元（3.9 亿美元）的管理资金，此后澳大利亚上市公司 GQG Partners 的股价周一下跌了 13%。【原文：Shares of Australian-listed GQG Partners fell 13% on Monday after UBS analysts downgraded the stock and estimated the firm could have lost A$600 million ($390 million) in funds under management following the Adani Group indictment.】

item.title: 澳大利亚任命特斯拉主席登霍尔姆领导研发绩效审查工作
item.description: 澳大利亚周一任命特斯拉主席罗宾-登霍尔姆（Robyn Denholm）领导对该国研发绩效的审查工作，以提高经济增长。【原文：Australia appointed Tesla chair Robyn Denholm on Monday to lead a review of the country's research and development performance, in an attempt to improve economic growth.】

item.title: 中国数据向好，以色列-黎巴嫩停火局势动荡，石油价格上扬
item.description: 受世界第二大石油消费国中国工厂活动向好的支撑，以及以色列不顾停火协议恢复对黎巴嫩的袭击，加剧了中东地区的紧张局势，周一油价有所上扬。【原文：Oil prices edged up on Monday supported by upbeat factory activity in the world's second largest oil consumer China and as Israel resumed attacks on Lebanon despite a ceasefire agreement, stoking tensions in the Middle East.】

item.title: 美元在利率和政治不确定性中走高
item.description: 周一，美元悄然走高，本周对于美国降息前景而言至关重要，而日元近期的反弹则是受到了国内利率上升赌注的支撑。【原文：The dollar crept higher on Monday in what is shaping up to be a critical week for the prospect of U.S. rate cuts, while the yen's recent rebound was underpinned by wagers on rising rates at home.】

item.title: 澳大利亚零售业在提前打折中加快增长步伐
item.description: 澳大利亚 10 月份的零售额增幅超过了预期，原因是减税政策已渗透到工资总额中，而且消费者对利率不会再次上调也更有信心，尽管宽松货币政策看起来仍然遥遥无期。【原文：Australian retail sales rose by more than expected in October as tax cuts flowed through to wage packets and consumers became more confident that interest rates would not increase again, although monetary easing still looked distant.】

item.title: 美元面临美国利率紧缩周，日元保持涨势
item.description: 周一，美元走势谨慎，因为本周对美国降息前景而言至关重要，而日元近期的反弹则受到了国内利率上升赌注的支撑。【原文：The dollar started in a cautious mood on Monday in what is shaping up to be a critical week for the prospect of U.S. rate cuts, while the yen's recent rebound was underpinned by wagers on rising rates at home.】

item.title: 智库斯德哥尔摩国际和平研究所（SIPRI）称，世界百强防务集团 2023 年武器销售额增长 4
item.description: 一家领先的智囊团周一表示，受战争和地区紧张局势的推动，全球最大的100家国防设备制造商在2023年的武器销售额将增长4.2%，达到6320亿美元。【原文：The world's 100 biggest defence equipment makers increased their arms sales by 4.2% in 2023 to $632 billion, fuelled by wars and regional tensions, a leading think-tank said on Monday.】

item.title: 早间竞标特朗普的金砖警告照亮新兴外汇市场
item.description: 亚洲市场前瞻【原文：A look at the day ahead in Asian markets.】

item.title: 未来两年新西兰房价将小幅上涨：路透社民意调查
item.description: 路透社对住房专家进行的一项调查显示，随着利率的降低，市场在大流行病后出现了19%的回调，需求再次增加，预计未来两年新西兰房价将上涨5%左右。【原文：New Zealand home prices are forecast to rise around 5% in the next two years as lower interest rates boost demand again following a 19% correction in the market following the pandemic, according to a Reuters poll of housing experts.】

item.title: 消息人士称，Stellantis 首席执行官卡洛斯-塔瓦雷斯辞职
item.description: 预计将于周日晚些时候发布公告。【原文：An announcement is expected later on Sunday.】

item.title: 独家报道孟加拉国希望重新谈判阿达尼电力交易，除非法院取消该交易
item.description: 孟加拉事实上的能源部长周日告诉路透社，孟加拉希望大幅降低与印度陷入困境的阿达尼集团（Adani Group）的购电协议价格，除非法院取消该协议。【原文：Bangladesh wants to sharply lower prices under a power purchase deal with India's embattled Adani Group unless it is cancelled by a court, which has called for an investigation into the 25-year deal, its de facto energy minister told Reuters on Sunday.】

item.title: 部长表示，瑞银的资本要求应适度
item.description: 瑞士财政部长卡琳-凯勒-萨特（Karin Keller-Sutter）表示，由于瑞士试图在金融业竞争力和保护纳税人之间取得平衡，新的银行业法规对瑞银的资本要求应该 "适度"。【原文：Capital requirements set for UBS under new banking regulations should be "proportionate", as Switzerland attempts to strike a balance between financial sector competitiveness and protecting taxpayers, Finance Minister Karin Keller-Sutter said.】

item.title: 大众汽车工人在德国各地举行警告性罢工
item.description: 德国 IG Metall 工会表示，大众汽车工人将于周一在所有工厂举行警告性罢工，这是大众汽车国内业务自 2018 年以来的首次大规模罢工。【原文：Volkswagen workers will go on warning strikes on Monday at all plants, Germany's IG Metall union said, marking the first large-scale walkouts at Volkswagen's domestic operations since 2018.】

item.title: 美国需求疲软，韩国出口增长放缓至 14 个月低点
item.description: 周日的贸易数据显示，由于关税不确定性导致对美国和中国的出货量下降，韩国 11 月份的出口增长连续第四个月放缓，创下 14 个月以来的最弱水平。【原文：South Korea's export growth slowed for a fourth-straight month in November, to the weakest level in 14 months, as shipments to the United States and China fell amid tariff uncertainty, trade data showed on Sunday.】

item.title: 澳大利亚总理阿尔巴内斯称马斯克在社交媒体禁令批评中推动了 X 的议程
item.description: 澳大利亚总理安东尼-阿尔巴内塞周日表示，埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）对澳大利亚禁止 16 岁以下儿童使用社交媒体的批评是 X 的所有者在推动社交平台的议程，同时表示他愿意与这位亿万富翁就本周立法的禁令进行讨论。【原文：Australia Prime Minister Anthony Albanese said on Sunday that criticism by Elon Musk of Australia's social media ban on children under 16 was the X owner pushing an agenda for the social platform, while indicating he was open to talk to the billionaire about the ban, legislated this week.】

item.title: 高塔姆-阿达尼打破对美国贿赂起诉的沉默
item.description: 这位亿万富翁说，公司致力于 "世界级的合规性"，但没有提供更多细节。【原文：The billionaire said the company is committed to "world-class regulatory compliance," without giving further details.】

item.title: 黑色星期五数据显示美国购物者网上消费达 108 亿美元
item.description: Adobe Analytics 的数据显示，这一数字比一年前增长了 10%。【原文：It was a 10% rise from a year ago, according to Adobe Analytics.】

item.title: 瑞士央行主席称瑞士工业感受到德国的疲软
item.description: 瑞士国家银行主席马丁-施莱格尔（Martin Schlegel）周六表示，德国工业目前的疲软正在削弱瑞士制造业的需求。【原文：The current weakness in German industry is sapping demand in Switzerland's manufacturing sector, Swiss National Bank Chairman Martin Schlegel said on Saturday.】

item.title: 据天空新闻报道，汇丰银行开始物色下任董事长
item.description: 据天空新闻周六报道，总部位于英国的汇丰控股董事会已指定猎头公司开始招聘下一任主席，接替马克-塔克（Mark Tucker）。【原文：UK-headquartered HSBC Holdings' board has appointed headhunters to start the recruitment of its next chairman to succeed Mark Tucker, Sky News reported on Saturday.】

item.title: 据彭博新闻社报道，日产汽车首席财务官斯蒂芬-马即将卸任
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周六援引知情人士的话报道，日产汽车首席财务官马世民（Stephen Ma）即将卸任。【原文：Nissan Motor's CFO Stephen Ma is set to step down, Bloomberg News reported on Saturday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 百度 Apollo 自动驾驶汽车获准在香港测试
item.description: 中国百度获得了在香港测试自动驾驶汽车的许可证，其阿波罗机器人出租车服务将在中国大陆以外的地区开展。【原文：China's Baidu has received the licence to test autonomous vehicles with its Apollo robotaxi service in Hong Kong as it expands its footprint outside Chinese mainland.】

item.title: 摩根大通同意撤销对特斯拉股票权证的诉讼
item.description: 美国贷款机构摩根大通（JPMorgan Chase）周五同意撤销对电动汽车制造商特斯拉（Tesla）提起的与股票权证交易有关的诉讼。【原文：U.S. lender JPMorgan Chase agreed on Friday to drop its lawsuit filed against electric vehicle maker Tesla linked to stock warrant transactions.】

item.title: 中国 11 月工厂活动连续第二个月扩张
item.description: 周六，一项官方调查显示，11 月份中国工厂活动连续第二个月温和增长。 周六的一项官方调查显示，11 月份中国工厂活动连续第二个月小幅增长，最近的一系列数据表明，刺激经济的大潮终于在这个世界第二大经济体中蔓延开来。【原文：China's factory activity expanded modestly for a second straight month in November, an official survey showed on Saturday, adding to a string of recent data suggesting a blitz of stimulus is finally trickling through the world's second-largest economy.】

item.title: 消息人士称道明银行聘用汇丰加拿大前首席合规官
item.description: 三位消息人士告诉路透社，道明银行已聘请加拿大皇家银行的乔治亚-斯塔夫里迪斯（Georgia Stavridis）担任金融犯罪风险管理副总裁，这是一个新设立的职位。【原文：TD Bank has hired Georgia Stavridis from Royal Bank of Canada to become a vice president in financial crimes risk management, a newly created role, three sources told Reuters.】

item.title: 巴西卢拉提名 Bradesco 首席交易员担任央行货币政策主管
item.description: 巴西总统路易斯-伊纳西奥-卢拉-达席尔瓦（Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva）周五表示，巴西央行提名 Bradesco 银行首席交易员尼尔顿-大卫（Nilton David）从 1 月份开始担任央行下一任货币政策主管。【原文：Brazilian President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva nominated Nilton David, head trader at Bradesco bank, to serve as the next monetary policy director at the central bank starting in January, the institution said on Friday.】
